content: Create a humorous five-line poem in an anapestic meter that describes a sandy shore, highlighting the experience of sunbathing, swimming, and the sound of waves crashing onto the shore. Use playful rhyming patterns to enhance the entertaining aspect of the piece.

On the sandy shore where the sunbeams do play,  
I’ll sunbathe and swim in a lazy ballet.  
With a splash and a dive, I’ll feel oh so alive,  
As the waves crash and dance in a foamy display.  
Oh, the seagulls above join the laughter and love, hooray!
